description: Great place, great service. The atmosphere and the patrons make me feel like it is my home away from home. Johnnie, mike, Tommy and Micky (the Irish lad) fo a great job.. keep it up.
author: Anthony H.

description: Wow, my favorite bartender is gone. The music can be heard down the street and no one knows their beers like my favorite who is no longer there. Can't believe this place is no longer what it was, sad!
author: Megan P.

description:
Love the atmosphere of this bar. It's nice and divey, and has a great patio area which is one of the more spacious patios in the city equipped with overhead "roofs" for those rainy days. The beers/drinks are all reasonably priced. Not the strongest I've had in the city, but always to the mediocre expectations of what I expect at a bar. 
I'm still very puzzled at the whole "inn" part of their name. Is there a hotel connected to this place that I'm not seeing?!
Oh and also, it's a cool place to catch a game with their nice sized televisions. Perfect for those weekly games if everywhere else that you go to is busy. Thank you Pilsner Inn!
author: Nick A.

description:
This was my local go-to bar when I lived in the Castro. As a straight woman, I never felt out of place and the bartenders still recognize me (and remember which drink I always ordered) even though I have been gone a year.

It's a pretty large (and popular) bar. They have a big patio out back with lots of seats and nice plants. It's popular with smokers. They have a pool table and some great pinball machines, and a great jukebox.

Because it can get crowded, keep an eye out for the 2 places at the bar where you order drinks - there's an obvious service area (with no bar stools), and usually a very orderly line. Drinks are strong and cheap.
author: Rachel R.

description: Why would I expect to get service sitting at the bar for over 20 minutes by some hateful person who obviously doesn't like their job or tips.  There's no reason to snarl at people or slam glasses down once they place their order
author: Jamie M.

description: This bar backyard is bar backyard that all bars backyards wish they were :)  Drink specials are fantastic - I had a great $4 IPA.  The PRIDE IPA is also fantastic, but they only have it for a limited time - hurry in and try!
author: Emma H.

description: I stopped into the Pilsner for happy hour with friends. Loved the beer and back patio but what made the evening was Michael the bartender. He knew most of his punters, has a fun personality, great service with an irish accent to boot. Had such a fun evening.
author: Catriona M.

description:
I have lived a few doors down this bar for 4 years and have been a few times here with my friends and my dog; I used to like it because their drinks are fine, and bar's atmosphere is very laid-back. 
That was until the last time I attempted to get in, and I was stopped by the bartender because apparently, dogs are not allowed; once I said that's weird because I have brought my dog here before, and they heard my accent, they were so nice to explain everything to me about hygiene rulings that apply to such establishments. Instead of apologizing for their own inconsistency, they pretty much kicked me out. Needless to say I will never come back - there are plenty of bars in the neighborhood who have a much friendlier attitude (and drinks, to be fair).
author: Eirini P.

description:
I came here during the week leading up to Pride with a friend. They were hosting some political event where members of the Harvey Milk LGBT Democratic Party collaborated with the bar and this outside vendor that sold pulled pork. We originally came here for the pulled pork but it was expensive AF. Almost $15 just for a sandwich? I'll just go somewhere else and get something half of that, lol.

Anyway, I ordered a Blue Moon and it was good enough to last me over an hour since my friend and I just talked and introduced to his friends. There were also some San Francisco political figures that stopped by which was pretty cool.

There's an outdoor seating outside but people were smoking so we decided not to stay there for too long.
author: Aj C.

description: Tried to get the Chimay here on Tuesday... keg had just run dry. Here on Friday, ordered a Chimay, keg is dry. Not accusing, but, like, do they actually have it here? Tuesday was 11/14, tonight was 11/17, did anyone have the Chimay here between those dates?
author: Nick R.

description:
After visiting Aardvark Books next door I had some time to kill so I cruised in here to grab a pint and read some of my books. I guess technically it's a "gay" bar but on a slow Saturday afternoon it was just a chill sports bar. Some games were on the TV and a few people were shooting pool. I was pleasantly surprised to see a pretty good craft selection on draft. I got the "Wilhelm Scream", a seasonal pumpkin beer from Magic Hat Brewing Company and settled into a sunny front corner to read. I didn't check out the patio but that looked very pleasant as well. All in all a lovely hour or so was spent enjoying a beer and book. The bartender was very nice as well.

STEPH JUDGEMENT: Great casual and welcoming place to get some drinks on.
author: Steph H.

description: Fun bar to have a drink with friends.  The outdoor area is nice for socializing and smoking.
author: Dennis W.

description: This is one of the best bars around town. Friendly staff, a large selection of beers (with nightly specials), pinball machines (including my personal favorite: theatre of magic), and an amazing back patio with plenty of seating (as well as standing tables). This is a comfortable place to come have a beer, play pool or pinball and have a smoke on the patio. I love this place and will continue to be a loyal patron.
author: Alex E.

description:
One of my preferred places to hang out in this neighborhood, if only because it's never too crowded here. As such, you can always get a drink quickly from the bar. There's also lots of room both inside and in the rear outdoors patio to spread out and have some real conversation with friends without having to yell in each others' ears. The ambience is also airy and accessible enough so as to avoid sketchy-dive-bar status.

A solid bet if everything else in the neighborhood is jam-packed.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Went in to this place last month and again last night. It's one of the closest bars to my new place. The bar's nice and they've got a good selection of beers, a patio out back, and pool and pinball -- but the douche at the counter is unreal.

Looks like the guy from TVs Cash Cab but this is a lower class knockoff type. 
Trash Scab seems about right. 

Rude, obnoxious and obviously doesn't want to be in a customer service position. (hello! craigslist.org has jobs ads.) He yelled at me for not ordering in the right place (Silly me, thought the bar was the right place to order, but apparently at this place it's only two feet of the bar). Long and short of it is I've been there twice now. Fool me three times, uh, no. Won't be back
author: Theo S.

description:
Great patio, nice guys, fun pool table, pinball machines, arcade games.

They've got a bathroom that locks, too, which I love.

Some rude-ass bartender last night. Bald maybe? Some friends were telling me he'd taken a testy tone with them for no reason, and I initially didn't believe them until I was standing and waiting for a drink.

He pointed really obviously, like I was riding the short bus. "To get a drink, you have to go OVER THERE. Geez, I thought you people would have figured that out by now."

I'm sorry, no. If you don't like people in bars, don't work in one. Happy New Years to you, too. Hope your manager sees this.
author: David S.

description: I walked into this place with a prosthetic arm and a service dog and was immediately told to leave. The bartender Al went on to ask me what my disability was, what she does for me and proof.  Two out of three questions he asked wrong with a obvious disability will only lead to a full on inquiry because of people like me don't stand up for others with disabilities like myself the the rest of us get repressed and looked down on for who we are.
author: Brad B.

description:
Go for the chill outdoor patio where you can enjoy a cold brew, just know that ciggy smokers are welcome here. 

Go for the well used pool table, antique looking photo booth and all business bartender. 

Go for the ($6!) Tanqueray G&T: it was all gin and almost no tonic! Well, they like to keep it STIFF in the Castro!
author: Janice C.

description: First time there after having it recommended by a friend. Horrible experience. Rude patrons and then the staff was even worse. We got treated like absolute trash. With so many great bars in the area, definitely will not be returning.
author: Emily J.

description:
I love the back patio, but I have never had a good experience with the staff. Today a staff member yelled at me when I called looking for my lost wallet. I called once and he said they didn't have it, when I called again to explain it was a gold cigarette case not a standard wallet he got angry. "You called already! I said we don't have it! You asked and I looked and we don't have it!" 

I know it's a frustrating job, and they must get similar calls all the time, but just a little hospitality wouldn't be a bad thing. Even just listening to what I was saying would have been preferable to being cut off. It's really sad, because this was one of the neighborhood go-to's for a lot of my friends, but after hearing their stories and now this none of us will be going back. Don't want to drink at a place where you feel antagonized by the staff.
author: Danielle D.

description: The place was big, open and decent when we walked in. The bartender not knowledgeable at all. Asking about stouts he had no clue. Looking at the tap handles I said ill take that stout. He seemed confused and possibly drunk? He was very out of it. The pricing here is high for beers, however, it is better than a dive bar. :) The older patrons were pretty rude and did not mind taking up excessive space. This was definitely a decent place. The back patio seemed very fun, however, it was just viewing. We were not out there to enjoy a drink. Overall a decent place with beers and some pinball. By the way, please clean the pond out back. The water is WAY too cloudy and murky. That is not good for the koi. :)
author: Big D.

description: The Pilsner Inn deserves great respect for being a place that welcomes all scenes. (Since the Lex closed, it's been popular with women on Friday and Saturday evenings, but truly everyone is welcome and has a good time.) There is a vast selection of beers on tap and wonderful bartenders. I've enjoyed meeting tourists (both gay and straight) from all over the world who find their way to Pilsner Inn. Whether to give a fifth star has to do with the outdoor patio. People who still partake of tobacco would definitely award the fifth star. People who wish the patio had a non-smoking section probably would withhold it. The inside bar, of course, is smoke-free and inviting.
author: Ted C.

description:
Is this even a gay bar anymore?  There used to be really awesome bartenders but not the case anymore... the barback seriously sat behind the bar chatting up some chick for over 20 minutes when I got here tonight.  Nobody offered to get me a drink even though I had cash out in my hand waiting.  

The crowd tonight is also the most annoying, obnoxious group I've seen in here ever.  Overly pretentious wannabe frat boy geeks and loud, screaming loud, chicks everywhere.  There were, of course, a few lesbians that we're hanging out and a couple of gays.  The rest, who knows... I gave it two stars in the hope that it will be the chill spot to drink, hang out, play pool or video games and have a few drinks.  I doubt it though, judging by the way this city is quickly becoming a douche haven.
author: Michael B.

description: The Pilsner is a priceless gem in San Francisco. Everyone is welcome. The bartenders are friendly - especially Johnny. The drinks are strong. The regulars are welcoming. The penguin collection is priceless. Definitely one of my faves in the Castro.
author: Thomas M.

description: I have been along time fan. know a bartender or two. but the new extraordinarily loud music since about March is unbearable. even the bartender couldn't hear my order. not going back till they go back to a reasonable level for a neighborhood bar
author: Joey D.

description: I love the Pilsner.  Great drinks, great beer selection and great staff. Love the outside patio and the vibe.  One negative: It's it's too bright inside. They need to dial back the lights a bit to provide a little intimacy.
author: Christian M.

description:
No frills casual dive bar.

The service was friendly; the cider on tap was decent.
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
Been going here for 10 years and just got kicked out for having a half can soda I didn't buy from them. You just lost a long time customer due to an a-hole bar tender (guy with a pony tail). Apparently smoking pot, bringing pets, and bringing in food is welcome, but not a half empty can of soda even though you are in the process of paying for a drink you already ordered and the bar tender poured. 

There are a couple of great bar tenders here and then there are the few with power trips that ruin the whole place.
author: Angelito R.

description: Nice, quaint, neighborhood bar. It's a low key and very casual kind of place.  Came here with friends after our shift was over. Nice drinks with no attitude here.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Nice size glass. Took the bartender all of 2 minutes to make. Tasted like slightly chilled straight vodka. Poured it in the glass and it overflowed. Lifted to drink and spilled more. Ask for dirty, came clear as water. Only 2 olives. 

-3 Olives.
author: Gregory P.

description:
A very hot day in San Fran today, very hot. We don't  drop by The Pilsner very often, however, bartender du jour, Johnny, served up some 'cool' drinks and made us feel welcome.  Seems everyone here is always in a good mood.

Hopefully see ya all soon Pilsner!
author: Bobby J.

description:
Recently, when asked to decide upon a neighborhood bar with a good back patio, my mind brings me to Pilsner. (My thirst makes me actually go.) Pilsner is an old school sports bar. (Hence why I laughed when Hi Tops was being called the "first" gay sports bar in the Castro-- not that I don't love Hi Tops, but it's not true!) In fact, the only times I've felt crowded at Pilsner is during a big sports event (local or otherwise, as they often host events supporting various local sports groups).

But, the real reason we go is for the back patio. It's got a plastic covering, meaning it's got wonderful light while being sheltered from much wind. There's a small alcove for a large group to the right, long benches and various tables throughout-- making any spot a good one to be at. There isn't a lot of music, meaning having a conversation is easy. Yes, this is a smoking patio (for tobacco or... whatever was picked up at the Apothecarium) but spacious enough that it shouldn't overtly offend those with sensitive noses. AKA, this back patio perfectly suits a grumpy gay man who hates crowds and loud music (AKA what I am quickly becoming).

Come for the beer, stay for the patio!
author: Bryan B.

description: This review is solely based on the bald bartender who was working on a Wednesday night! Not everyone has a same taste. Just because we didn't like the beer you recommended you don't have to be a jerk about it. Just so rude and unprofessional!! You can tell he's an ass from the previous reviews! Never coming back!! If you hate your job don't work in customer service, it's obvious you're taking your shit out on customers.  I hope the owner reads this!
author: Kay L.

description:
I really love Pilsner Inn.  Every time I visit the bar tenders have been super friendly and I've always met new and interesting people in the back patio area.

Drinks are reasonably priced, and it seems like it's never too crowded.  They make a pretty delish bloody mary - btw.

They have a pool table and a couple of pinball machines, and there's ample seating inside the bar as well as on the back patio.

Conveniently located to public transit and a number of yummy eating spots.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Torn between 4 and 5. Really friendly local
bar with nice service. Not necessarily fancy but not really divey either. Good beer selection. Good service. Would actually give it a 5 if it weren't for the smoking on the back courtyard deck, which is somehow permissible, but still gross. Otherwise, great place for either a drink on a weeknight or a fun Saturday out.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Now *this* place we found in SF is Awesome!!  After a horrifying experience elsewhere, we came in not expecting much.  A World Cup game had just ended and the daytime crowd left quickly.  Which was kinda cool. The place is pretty big.... Lots if big TV's around. The pool table was in use the whole time we were there....
Which ended up being 4 or 5 rounds beyond my expectations!  The pinball machines got mii first.  They had 2 next to the pool table. 

The super-nice older bartender humored my drunken inquiries about the penguin motif....  Has to do with an "inside-thing" between the couple that owns the place.  That I get, we've got a thing about pointing out Zebras to each other.  (Long story). So the penguins make sense in a cute-couple kinda so sweet you gag in a GOOD way.  

We got lucky and it was spectacular weather for a Sunday in July.  The back patio was pretty.  We took pictures of some of the flowers and a dragonfly that landed nearby. Pretty and the whole place is accessible. There was a guy hanging out back there in his wheelchair.   Not that i need the accessibility. But nice to see a bar in ADA compliance. 

All in all, we will likely go back next time we are in the neighborhood 

Almost forgot the decorations overhead!  It was a full week after Pride events wound down. But they still had an awe-inspiring balloon rainbow arch thingie overhead   
Must have cost some $ and taken a ton of time..... I can see why they left it up  :)
author: Tiffany J.

description: The bartender was such a DICK to me eww never coming back again. Rude all the way. As I remember he was bald? or grey hair. I understand that he's probably sick of working there but come on, if a customer asks you simple question then just give simple answer. Don't work customer service jobs if you hate people THAT much.
author: George H.

description: I've been working in the service industry for my entire professional career and I'm disappointed by the disrespect of the staff in this bar.
author: Cassidy S.

description:
I like the Pils. It's not glamorous, it's not flashy, it's just the place you go when you want to chill out and have a drink but not really be a part of the scene.

REALLY wish they'd disallow smoking on the back patio though. Sucks as a non-smoker when your reward for making a good decision is that you get to choose between stuffy (inside) and carcinogenic (outside).
author: Sean B.

description:
Well, well, well... the Pilsner.

It's amazing how many people zeroed in on a 4-star rating for this place. That  just feels right, doesn't it?  Well above average place, tho not exceptional.  The comfort level is likely what we're all yapping about.  You can feel good and comfortable here. People are just people here, no one is conspicuously present (if you know what I mean). 

Back in the old days, when I lived on Liberty Street, I sometimes stopped in to sit at the window seat closest to Market Street.  It was a favorite roost -- far enough from the pool tables to avoid cramping someone's shot, up next to the street to take in the early evening's activity. If it was a cold and rainy evening it was even better: cozy inside, looking at people rushing around in the weather. There's usually something interesting to see, like passengers on the J MUNI. Are they art majors or young people who escaped from Iowa and are overcompensating?

I'm not much of a beer drinker (1 or 2 beers a month, ha!) but when it's time for a tasty brew I want to sit some place that feels special without pretentious or snotty people around. Here I feel like I'm among a really decent slice of humanity, just the right amount of friendliness.  I'm grateful for places like this because with all the crap in life  there are still spots where all of it is kept at bay.  You can reassure yourself that it's far far away. On cold evenings this is a great place where you can watch the world.  And get some reassurance that everything is better than you thought before.

So there you have it, a recommendation from someone who doesn't really drink much.
author: Noe B.

description: Cheap and divey with a patio. Draws a serious crowd, at least on the Friday night that I went.
author: Vivian H.

description: Our first time in the Castro district after a nice dinner and I have to say I was very impressed with this place. The bartenders are super cool, drinks are strong but very cheap and everyone there was laid back. If we are ever in this area again I am sure we will back to this place.
author: Matthew M.

description: This is my neighborhood bar and I've been going here for nearly 9 years. Perfect place to play pool, hang out in a flower-ridden patio and see your regulars. Reasonably priced, lots of beers on tap, and awesome bartenders.
author: Paradise S.

description:
Strong pours. ESPN bumping in the daytime. Great staff. Fun people to talk to . And one of the best backyard drinking areas in the city. And no shade thrown to heteros which is really nice because as Depeche Mode did try to remind us,"people are people so why should it be, you and I should get along so awfully".

I love you Pilsner
author: Lauren V.

description: relaxing  bar  and most staff friendly  . The outdoor smoking area is great except choking on the pungent smell of pot at times
author: Andy W.

description: Love it here.  Cheap beer, not too crowded, and they let you smoke your medicinal marijuana in the back if you need it.  Love the pinball, too.
author: Ryan S.

description: It's full of good times and good people. You can smoke on the back patio. Tom the bartender is one of the best.
author: Thomas F.

description: Somehow, the sun seems to shine right on this patio, every day. With the space to comfortably play pool, pinball, a trough, a selection of beer of Napa Smith IPA and a rotating $4 IPA special, relaxed bartenders and regulars, this bar is as good of a neighborhood bar there is in the city. Bring in an Ike's or Dinosaurs....
author: Jon A.

description:
It's all about the back patio, at least when the weather isn't shit. And like a typical gay bar, strong ass drinks.

Cheers.
author: Justin N.

description:
Pilsner made my night this Friday.  I  asked for the bathroom key  - not long after I arrived here.  The bartender paused - and then asked for my ID. I didn't have it on me - so I said I'd be back with it. 

As I found my way back to my bag - I had a crazy big smile on my face. Someone asked me where was I was going. And when I revealed that I was trying to find my ID - they seemed confused.

I was thrilled though.  Being IDed when you haven't even asked for a drink yet - is huge. It's truly a massive compliment! I couldn't wait to head back to the bar with my tattered ID.

Outside of awesome - complimentary bartenders - who kept my water glass full - throughout my time here - I loved how big this space is - and the warm positive vibes that moved throughout it. Their bathroom was clean and accessible - and their back patio is truly What's Up.

Seriously if you're ever trying to find a unique space for an event or get-together - the Pilsner Inn is a wonderful spot. Their back stretching patio has a nice cover on it  - which keeps the wind out - but keeps the gorgeous San Francisco light- in. 

Pilsner feels like a warm familiar friendly hug. Which is the ideal way to begin a long weekend.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I like the Pilsner Inn, it has a nice little homey bar feel to it - even though it's located on the very busy corner of Church and Market. 

It has a nice little pool table, pinball machines and a nice little outdoor area that is covered. Nice little bar for group events.

The drinks were strong, my second drink was even stronger. I definitely appreciated the good service over at the Pilsner Inn.
author: Rebekah T.

description: A small little gay bar. There isn't much room from the door to the back, worry about bumping into people either on the stools or playing pool. The men's restroom has a tub men pee in or a one stall. The women has a private room. The backyard can fit about 20 people.
author: M C.

description: One of my favorite haunts. You're never feeling crowded, the vibe is very welcoming and neighborhoody, and you can actually take your friends there and enjoy each other rather than shouting over some screeching diva thumping out the speakers. Plus the patio is my everything.
author: Brad F.

description:
Had a round of drinks here last night -- one of the last stops on a Halloween crawl in the Castro. Bald male bartender was incredibly rude (looks like another reviewer had a similar experience). 

I order two drinks for me and my friend. My third friend, after contemplating what to order, chimes in. I tell the bartender the third drink order as he's bringing our two drinks. 

He says something along the lines of, "For fuck sake, can't you order your drinks at once? Look how damn busy it is here." I look around and it's the least crowded bar I've been to all night -- in fact, it didn't even have half as many people as the last bar we had just been in. My friend and I look at each other baffled. 

But hey -- I get it. It's Halloween and a busier than average night for you. I just don't know why you have to be such an asshole about it. A simple, "Hey let me take care of these other people first and I'll get back to you." would have been perfectly fine. Because really... you're going to give me shit for ordering drinks at a bar?
author: Edward Y.

description:
Great bar to chitchat in without having to talk over the thumpa thumpa. Cute penguins above the bar and especially a set of penguin stuffed animals that I think I own too from Sears... Nice selection of beers and cheapish too ($3.75 before tip). 

Patio looks like it'd be awesome in the warmer months.
author: Kevin L.

description:
After watching the Michigan-Butler game (and many delicious beers later) at Toronado's, we stumbled into Pilsner for some afternoon sun and even more delicious brews. 

I really like the patio at Pilsner. It's well-lit with the transparent canopy and it never gets smoky even when it's crowded on Friday night. The seating is well designed so everyone has space, yet it all feels very intimate and social at the same time. 

Since it was nice and sunny out, I knew 21st Amendment's Watermelon Wheat would be the perfect brew for the conclusion of our lazy Saturday afternoon of drinking. It's light and delicious with just a hint of watermelon after. 

If you haven't been to Pilsner Inn's patio yet, I strongly encourage you to. It's really a great place to enjoy a perfect sunny San Francisco day with a nice brew in hand.
author: Jon L.

description:
It's a fine establishment in a great area.  Mostly cute old guys playing pool.

But specifically, Pilsner is prime if you are a smoker, because that's all people do on the back patio.  Like, smoke 'till they die.  In which case, I usually don't love coming here because all of my friends smoke.  Henceforth, I get a load of wonderful secondhand and end up smelling like an old house fire.  Cough cough, can we go now??
author: Rachelle P.

description: Bartender was a dick to my partner on her birthday. Honestly, little bit if class would've been appreciated, but apparently this isn't that kind of place.
author: P M.

description:
The bullet points:
- Friendly staff (always)
- Outdoor area (that is smokey)
- Bathrooms are on the gross side of life
- Cheap
- Friendly clientele 

Even though I go here a fair bit, I cannot justify giving this more than 3 stars, as I tend to only go here because it is inoffensive, has an outdoor area, and relatively cheap, not because it is awesome.  Sad, but true.
author: Tia B.

description:
I went to this bar after work the other night and it was on the slow side, which was perfect. The bartenders were soo nice and chatty - I loved them (they are the reason for this review). 

I was meeting up with someone who while en route had a nasty bike accident. After showing up bloody to the bar, the bartenders, without hesitation were offering towels, peroxide, band-aids, packs of ice.

I will definitely come back again, just to hang on more of a mellow level with a beer, some pinball and a surprisingly large back patio.
author: Leslie T.

description: like the pool table go as the designated driver sober person free soda with my group im a fan good place to watch a game with friends
author: Leigh G.

description: The back patio is great. It's nicely shaded and tented with lots of foliage everywhere, but smokers allowed so keep that in mind. The bartenders were nice. Drinks are strong and the beer selection is great. I only had eyes for the 21st Amendment IPA. I didn't think prices were actually that cheap, but fair. This place is cash only.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Pilsner Inn - sounds kind of fancy and posh, eh? Well, it's neither and that's just how we like it! It is a great, neighborhood, divey sort of hang out. They have a full bar,  back patio that can be used all year 'round, and a pool table. 
The pool table is a bit of a hassle (the space is too small and you know those certain pool players that think they are on tour and get angry if you are innocently enjoying a drink AT THE BAR and their stick bumps you..), but other than that I really enjoy the place. 
They have a few big screens up and it's one of my top picks for grabbing a beer with friends and watching whatever sporting event is happening at the time. The bartenders are pouring big drinks, lots of beer on tap and you can carry food in from nearby restaurants. 
It's in a great location - close to muni and bus lines. And you can get anywhere in the Castro in about 5-7 mintues from the Pils.
author: Shannon K.

description: The bartenders are exceptionally rude and condescending.  It is a dive, but the bartenders act as if being there is a privilege they're extending.  It has a back patio, which is its only cool feature, but it smells bad and is not worth being around the cocky and rude staff members.  The rude staff seem to cater to a few regulars who are also rude except with each other.  I wouldn't waste my time here again.  If you want a patio, go to The Mix on 18th between Castro and Noe.
author: Kevin J.

description: Love this bar. Strong drinks, solid draft selection, and a fantastic back patio scene. It doesn't hurt that it's directly adjacent to Aardvark Books, also highly recommended.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Not a bad space.
Beer specials are nice, and plenty of nice ones to choose from on tap.
Music was fine at first, but that was then squelched in favor of the ball game.
Whatever.
One pool table, two pinball machines, and a soft-tip dart machine.
Came looking for a dart board, and this was a let down.
author: Ken B.

description:
Most people don't even notice the penguin theme until i point it out.

This bar is never crowded and i like it. Good to hang out for a bit and have some beers.
author: Phuong M.

description:
We went here?

I do not recall.

Lack of recollection is an automatic 3 stars.

DAMMIT, my brain sucks.
author: Pam S.

description:
Wow--hostile bartender tonight.  After ignoring the four of us for a while, the orange t-shirt wearing bartender finally approached us after we waived to him.  The bill came to $24.00 for four drinks.  My friend put $25.00 on the the bar ( a twenty and a five) and another friend already had a $10.00 bill on the bar.  The bartender swiped all of the money and put it in the register.  We all told him that he made a mistake.   He got defensive and angry and  wouldn't correct it until the older bartender who was also working that shift asked him to give us the extra $10.00 back.  He threw the $10.00 bill on the bar and said "here!"   We also found out that he was training a new employee that night too--nice job with showing him how to handle customers!
So tired of poor service.  Management--why do you allow this?
The bartender who got our money back also told us that there is yet another drink maker there who waits for the customers to come to him first.  Apparently, his entitiled attitude is even worse.  What a dump.  I've felt this way every time I've been in there.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I had to go to the bathroom, and I had a hard time manuvering the door. (???)

I knock off a star for their dirty bathroom, but at the time I realllly didn't care. 

They were SO NICE. I had a hard time figuring out why there was a key on the door outside the bathroom but no lock? So I stood there trying to read the sign (which was about 4 paragraphs long) and a couple guys helped me out by saying "Just take the key in no one will bother you". 

Sweet! And their Stella is awesome here. Right next to Chow, so you should come here when waiting for a table and a super delicious dinner. 

I don't recommend getting drunk here beforehand, though.
author: Jaime L.

description: Pretty cool neighborhood bar with a solid following.   Thank you for supporting all 500 of your softball teams!   We all really appreciate it
author: Matt V.

description:
This is a love letter for Pilsner Inn, written by a regular. 

I've been coming here at least once a week for over six years. My then-girlfriend (now wife) stumbled across Pilsner Inn with her cousin after they moved into the neighborhood. A low-key gay/neighborhood bar with good beers, friendly bartenders, and an outdoor smoking patio? Sold! Soon after I would come across the bay and meet up with them as well, always having a good time.

Almost every patron is a local and/or a regular. In fact, most of us know each other well enough on sight, but not very often by name. We're just there to have a good time, be social, and continue on with our lives. Which is not to say it's for "regulars only", nor that it's an unfriendly bar; I've met a lot of great people there, and have had many parties mingle together.

And with a mixed crowd comes a mixed juke box. Johnny Cash, Frank Sinatra, Lady Gaga, the Rolling Stones...whatever...always entertaining.

Now, that being said, even though this is probably my favorite bar in the city, it has only recently become a decent beer bar. They have the requisite American lagers, but they've been expanding the IPA and local line a little too. A good day for me was when they started carrying Lagunitas IPA; an even better day was when they starting carrying Sierra Nevada Torpedo!

And the bartenders...Tommy, Jeff, Warren, Mike, Johnny...they're all great. We consider them to be our friends and look forward to seeing them every time.

Oh, and do yourself a favor: never order a Mojito here. You will be stared at until you change your mind.
author: Chris H.

description: The sports bar feel is a little tacky, but it's fun because they have the patio, pool table, pinball and darts available. What I don't like is the service. So far I've experienced 3 different bartenders who were in lousy moods, bitchy, unfriendly and sometimes rude. Suggestion, if you're the only employee working for the night, try treating your customers with respect and personality if you expect them to come back. I've been there a number of times and typically see less than 15 people there at a time. Listen to your customers, they are the most valuable asset to your business.
author: Foodie F.

description:
I love this bar. David, the bartender we had, was fantastic to talk with and made my drinks wonderfully! I love the patio out back for smoking with all of the flowers and plants and awesome lights. And the penguins every just make it one of my all-time favorite bars. I would highly recommend this place!

It's not a very packed bar which makes it easy to move around and not get bumped into all of the time. There's a pool table you can play on, too. It's a gay friendly bar, and the people are nice.
author: Autumn D.

description:
A gay bar that isn't your typical gay bar.  If you doubt my statement that it's a gay bar, please note the following:

1) It's in the Castro (although on the eastern border)
2) There is a rainbow flag out front
3) The men's bathroom has a through-style urinal with a mirror above it.  Umm...hello?

So what makes Pilsner Inn unique is the patio out back.  On a warm night, it's the perfect spot to enjoy one of the many beers on tap and shoot the shit.  Oh, and as with most gay bars, they have stiff cheap drinks too.
author: John H.

description: Great neighborhood bar with a huge patio to enjoy my martini. When I want to hang out at a bar after work that is close to home, this is my go-to place.
author: Rich S.

description:
Two stars because it's the only gay bar with a good beer selection I've ever been to.
Digital jukebox, which sucks, especially since when it ate my money, the bartender just shrugged.  IF IT'S IN YOUR BAR IT'S YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO MAKE SURE IT FUCKING WORKS.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Well once again I found myself back at the Pilsner Inn this time on a Saturday night. I brought a friend who had never been to this place after we had dinner. I was glad to see that Steven was behind the bar once again. My friend and I found a few seats at his station had a great time.

The one down side to the night was while Steve was helping other customers the bar back came buy and I asked him for a glass of water at which point he gave me a dirty look. I thought maybe he didn't understand so I asked him again at which point he poured me a glass of water and gave me dirty look again.

Over all the two bartenders treated us well and we had a great night I just hope that barback doesn't treat other people in the same way. My last visit was on March 3rd.
author: Whisky T.

description:
My out of town friends brought me to Pilsner Inn on their last night before heading out.  This chill bar has an unpretentious crowd and seating by the windows.  (Perfect for people watching.)  They also have a pool table, darts and outdoor seating in the back.  

The cool thing about this place is that it's casual. It's a very laid back crowd and a laid back scene.  There's a small TV over the bar and a phone booth in the middle too.  

My only concern was when I used the restroom and maybe because I didn't see a lock.  But I was concerned someone would walk in on me and see all my glory.  And the restroom isn't off to the side, so anyone walking by would get a view!
author: Teri C.

description: Broken pinball machines don't add to the ambiance.  Bartender could have cared less.  Too noisy inside.  Patio is great as a cancer alley.  Very eclectic crowd.  Otherwise, low-key place with a good beer selection.
author: David S.

description: I really like this bar, but the one bartender here is ridiculous!  So I am a bartender, and NEVER HAVE I NOT GIVEN A CUSTOMER BACK THEIR CHANGE!!!  I ordered two beers and the total was $9 for the two beers.  I paid with $10 bill. He did give me my dollar back, so I asked him to confirm how much the total was and he replies $9  I would have probably let it slide if the bar was busy, but there was no more than 10 people in the place.  I am in the service industry, and I am a very generous tipper.  This is  unacceptable in so many ways!  He is about 5'9 brown short buzz cut, and sometimes he has a go T.
author: Tylr K.

description:
I've going to Pilsner off and on for years. It was a dive bar that lucked out when the no-smoking ordinance took over SF in the 90s!  That big patio became a lure and it became a place to order a drink before going over to Chow, which had just opened.  

Some of the same bartenders are still there.  It's owned by an old queen
who needs a reality check.  My biggest complaint is that they dont pay attention to glasses and Ive had a couple which have had some jagged chips on the  cusp which could rip someone's lips off.

The bartenders dont seem to give a good goddamned and 1 in particular crowds the jukebox with his own folky Bob Dylan taste.  It's just one of those places that won't get any worse and won't get any better.
Things just coast along.  They have some regulars who flip out if you dare play a song while their games are on, which is great to watch.

I prefer the similar looking Mix, where you can hear music on the patio--not so at the sort of troubled Pilsner...

Oh I met a woman at the Lucky 13 who told me she would never go there again after being mistreated rudely by one of their bartenders.  I can totally believe that....
author: Latin C.

description:
The Pilsner is hands down the WORST bar in The Castro. I'm ashamed to even have this bar in my own neighborhood.


They have 2 horrible bartenders that completely dislike women. They throw things at the patrons if you are rooting for a team they don't like. And they are total drama queens.  

 The place is dirty and evil.
author: Amie B.

description:
Penguins!! They have penguins painted high up on the walls, so naturally I felt right at home. 

Friendly folks, friendly drinks, and very nice outdoor patio. I'm sure that the pool table would be friendly too if you asked it.

It's within walking distance to so many things other things but, Pilsner, dear, sshhhhh, don't worry about that. I'm only walking towards you.

Friendly note: Plenty of lovely wood in here.
author: Loli L.

description:
I didn't know I was in a gay bar when I went here. It feels like it could be a sports bar. It's nice. I could take my boyfriend here and once he gets over his fear of the Castro...he'd kick it with the gays here like they were his buddies.

Honestly, if it wasn't for the rainbow flag I wouldn't have known.

It's nice to have a place like this to take tourists, family, etc who aren'tt ready for the HARDCORE HOMOS of Badlands. I could take my lesbian mommies here and we'd be cool.
author: Lana P.

description: A nice bar that feels like a dorm! Nice people and feels very relaxed! Pretty cheap beer!
author: Jesper H.

description: What Euge said - "gay bar?  I was at a gay bar?"   Pilsner is laid back with cheap beers and a come one, come-all vibe.  It could have been a bar anywhere in the city but it just so happened to be in the Castro.  I came to meet up with friends who were hooking up with another friend on a layover in the City.  They had just had dinner next door and so the Pilsner it was.  We met up, had a few drinks, shot the shit, and on to another watering hole it was.  I would totally come back here next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Joe B.

description:
One of my all time favorite bars in SF...i've only had one bad experience with a bartender here, but that was like 6 years ago...i think he since died ...so thats taken care of. (I had nothing to do with it!)
I suggest waiting in Warren's line...he is uber sexy, friendly, and never gives attitude....did i mention he is uber sexy???

Hi Warrren!
author: Ripley B.

description: Low key and very casual gay bar on the edge of the Castro.  Good place to wait if there is a line at Chow.  Beer selection was good.
author: Patrick S.

description: Wow, I met a lot of friendly guys here.  I ended up going to this place while on vacation like 4 times.  I like that they played sports on the TV.  My kinda guys were hanging out there.... I didn't care for the smoking patio out back.  yuck
author: Matt W.

description: Short Bald Bartender working on Halloween. You need to find a different job. Will it kill you to smile and not be so bitchy? You ruined one of my favorite bars and my night.  I will not be coming back.
author: Mike W.

description: Such a better area to be in, as far as bars, and Pilsner Inn is a large part of that. The whole pub is really cozy and on the right day, the back patio is just pure bliss. Not much to it other than that. No frills, just cozy pub bliss.
author: Chris W.

description:
I am no stranger to gay bars. So when La Novia pointed this place out to me on a random weeknight trip to San Francisco, I was more than happy to check out the Pilsner Inn.

There is a plenty to like about this place. For a gay bar, it has more than just gay patrons. It had a sloppy drunk guy, a sprinkling of sorority girls, and a few meathead guys who just wanted to play pool. 

It has an overall unpretentious vibe, a pool table, a nice patio, and a digital jukebox.

Unfortunately, when you let certain gay men control the jukebox, you get some interesting results. I had so sit through well over 25 excruciatingly painful songs before I could I hear my selection. The terrible song choices consisted of Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, Rhianna, and Colplay. The latter being the worst and lamest of them all.

Anyway, the night improved once my music selections came on. People at the bar started dancing and having fun. Or maybe the alcohol hit later. Who knows. But all I know is, a party is always better when you play Van Halen and not Coldplay. 

In the end, this place was pretty solid. As in 3-stars solid. But the torture of bad music and the fact this place only takes cash makes it go down a star.

Or maybe I am just bitter because none of the boys hit on me.
author: Archie G.

description: The Pilsner is my kind of bar. Casual and friendly with 'regular' guys just being guys, no twinks no drama (sorry twinks and dramas). Some of us actually like men with facial/body hair and a more masculine appearance . I love the back patio area. It's a great place to go and hang out with friends before or after dinner, or whatever. This is one of the few gay bars that will show sports on the video monitors, and we are not talking water sports.
author: Greg S.

description: Friendly neighborhood pub atmosphere with an awesome choice of draft beers!
author: Robert L.

description: local neighborhoody divey bar. the bartender was nice. there's a pool table to play in case you run out of things to talk about with your friends. if you don't come with friends at all, there are some random arcade games to play just so you don't look like an alcoholic. i prefer to cover my alcoholism/solo drinking habit by playing with my phone and pretending to text my non-existent friends.
author: Te R.

description:
Tonight there was a beer bust for the Pilnser Pups -- it was awesome. Good crowd, good drinks, and a great bar. Honestly this is probably the most chill, and the most laid back gay bar in the Castro area. 

Oh, and did I mention that they have a great jukebox (Journey! ACDC!) and an amazing beer selection? Yes! Beer! Good beer! That's typically an anomaly for gay bars - but not this one!

And of course, lets not forget their kick-ass back deck. It's great for the summer!
author: Tom A.

description: This is a great place to go with a friend or two, have a drink and relax; I especially love the outdoor patio!
author: Natalie M.

description: I wish I could have given a no star to this s*$&hole of a place..... My friends and I went to this bar last night and the bartender Gary (that's what he said his name was) was a total D.. bag. First of all he wanted to close the bar twenty minutes early, my friend wanted a beer so he asked for one and Gary yelled at my friend "Didn't you hear that the bar is close???" (yeah we were in shock and pretty pissed off) I can keep going on how obnoxious, rude and simply unacceptable the bartender was but I don't ant you to cry...  I'm never ever stepping a foot in this place and hope that you will read this review before going there. Also I would hope that the owner reads this review and does something about it, people go to bars to chill out (we were not drunk, we had just gotten off work in case you were wondering) not to get yelled at....
author: sandra b.

description:
This is the first time in my YELP life that I have ever written a review. Understand that I have relied on this site for many different reasons- but the service at this bar- a bar where my partner and I have spent THOUSANDS of dollars.... was so horrible that I HAD to write a review.... 

TERRIBLE
ATROCIOUS
EMBARRASSING! 

I mean for real. Terrible. 
I am a waiter in Florida. 
I came in on thursday the 11th and the service I received was abysmal. I was even tacky enough to relay the fact that I'm "IN THE BIZ", hoping that they wouldn't be fucking pricks to someone who was willing to shell out massive tips to these pieces of dung!. Well... they embarrassed themselves through and through. I will never go here again- they suck! They actually tried to be difficult. There are so many other places RIGHT DOWN THE STREET that you can go to and receive better service from cool cats. 

Seriously- This place was so terrible that I'm going to make it a point to monitor this site daily and email people who have missed the message about how much this place sucks! I will then instruct them on where else they can go and find better deals on liquor and common sense!
author: David K.

description:
Having vowed to boycott St. Paddy's Day following last year's debacle, which involved getting dumped for fat sorority girls doing car bombs, I gave my friends the ultimatum that if we did go out on amateur night it would have to be an entire spectrum away from blonde marina chicks and the guys that love them. 

Unless there's a new gay fetish involving sorority girls that I'm unaware of, the Pilsner was probably as far away from last year's drama as one could get  --as ideologically polarized as a Hooters opening in Kabul -- so I agreed.

A great scene -- dozens of beers on tap, pool table, patio in the back. My only bone to pick -- $4.75 for an Amstel Lite. Really? Seriously, in the body-obsessed Castro, lite beer should flow like water.
author: Suzanne R.

description: A pool table, a patio with plants and a pond with koi fish, friendly locals, and a great bartender named Mike, who makes great drinks at good prices.
author: Vani A.

description: My favorite place for a quick drink after a long day at work. Super nice staff, cheap drinks, beautiful patio. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone in the area. Also, it's my favorite place to have a conversation with a friend. The music isn't super loud and the people are nice.
author: Reuben D.

description:
Getting pounced on as I come out of the bathroom...

Bearish Gay Guy: You have excellent teeth. What are you doing here?
Me: Huh?
BGG: You're really pretty, and too straight for this place.
Me: Huh?
BGG: Have you ever seen Mean Girls? You could totally be a mean girl.
Me: Huh? 
BGG: I mean you look like one, not that you're a bitch. So, how the hell did you wind up here? Do you live in the Marina?
Me: Uh, no. 
BGG: Pacific Heights?
Me: Uh, no.
BGG: Ok, let me guess. You live in the Inner Sunset, but only because your friend Heather gets free rent from her parents. 
Me: Uh, no. I think I need to get back to my group. 
BGG: Ok, that's fine. I just think your teeth are perfect. And I'm obviously gay, but I love straight girls and always wind up dating them.
Me: Right. I need to go. Over there.

-------

Drinking a gin and tonic, talking with people next to the huge not occupied whatsoever bar, because hey, it's a bar, THAT'S WHAT YOU DO...

Bartender: Can you guys move? You're getting in the way of my business. 
Me: Huh?

----

Three stars for good ambiance and strong drinks. Two stars taken away for the bartender's odd requests and the BGG who not only was judgmental, creepily complimentary, and probably not even gay, but who also on his way out of the bar grabbed a certain part of my body that you just don't grab unless you can make me say more than "Huh?"
author: Devon S.

description: Great for an after work drinking session... the pool table and darts make the bar complete, but the outdoor smoking patio really rocks.
author: James V.

description:
As I said in my "Gay!" review, if I were a man, I'd be gay.  And I would come here.  Every Saturday.

I am a woman, however, and Pilsner Inn still fits the bill - in wonderful ways that appeal to those born with a hoo hoo.  In addition to the constant bathroom availability, I got to hear about latest (and old) conquests and hookups, smell a variety of colognes on men more than happy to hold out their wrists for me to smell, and learn about the perfect Marc Jacobs model.  To top it all off, when someone paid me a compliment, I knew he wasn't just trying to get into my pants.

I fearlessly put my name up on the board to get in on the running pool game (and promptly went from pool champion to pool disgrace).  But at the urging of my friend, I put my name back up for another game.  My would-be opponent was so nice to allow me to play with Tinna, but when I won, he didn't continue the "winner plays again" rule...he moved on to the next guy.  Apparently the little lady didn't fit in exactly the way she thought she did.  :-/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
In spite of that douchebaggery, I'm taking this opportunity to urge everyone to do your part for equality - please vote NO on prop 8!
author: Kerrie L.

description:
I'm gonna start a list called "Straight-friendly gay bars with pool tables."

When I start this list, Pilsner Inn will be right there at the top.

Hahahaha - as if there's such a thing as a gay bar that would turn away a straight guy.
author: Joe C.

description:
Where bears come to teach lesbians and a random straight couple how to waltz to Olivia Newton John.
True story.

Ridiculously pleasant back patio, and some mighty strong margaritas to boot.  (Drink from a boot?  Didn't do it.  But I'm sure that's someone else's true story from here.)

A San Francisco melting pot.  Welcome to all.  Fun *will* be had by all.
author: Ravena F.

description:
While technically a Castro bar, it's on the edge so you end up with a mixed crowd. Props for being a pretty cool sports bar with some damn strong drinks. The Vodka Redbull they gave me was served in a tall beer glass and was only a few bucks. 

Amazing!

Lots of room here and didn't get hit on. I should come here more often.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Random.

That is all I kept thinking during my visit here last night. Oh and, "Man, I'm really buzzed." But those are two excellent things to be experiencing and thinking in a bar on a Monday night. They say it's a gay bar, but as others have noted, it is a very friendly to breeders dwelling as well, which is cool since I live in this hood and generally like to go to places within stumbling distance.

As a true drinkable bonus, this place sells Freixenet Champagne by the bottle for only $18.00. Sure, it's a mark up from retail, but when the bank account isn't allowing the Crystal, there is nothin' wrong with a few glasses of Freixenet. The one bummer is that it's cash only; a usual drawback in a lot of SF bars, but other than that, it's a chill place to convene with friends and have some laughs.

Oh! And they have ELO in their jukebox! Numerous points for that :)
author: Stephy S.

description: I'm not really sure what the penguin theme is for, but I can dig it.  I also dig this no frills bar that has a clientele that appears mostly gay, but is not exclusively so.  I have come here twice and had some good beer, stiff cocktails, and great conversation on both occasions.  Was it the company?  Probably not.  But in such a cozy spot like this, how can you not enjoy yourself?
author: Jeremy G.

description:
One night, we were driving around town from this event to the next when I received a text:

"Come to the Castro and have beer w/ me."

Odd.  What is my allegedly straight friend "B" doing in the Castro?  On a late Thursday night?

But I was sold on beer, so off to the Castro we went.

Upon entering, not only is B there, but so are my other guy friends C and T.  All lined up.  In a row.  At the bar.

Amongst many, many other guys.

I looked around the room and one twirl later, I was quite certain that as suspected, this is a gay bar.  That's all fine and dandy, but what are THEY doing HERE?

Then again, what the hell am *I* doing here?

Hmph.

Sitting at the bar at Pilsner Inn was awesome, though.  The bartender was just a fabulous guy - and by the third round, he was giving us massive discounts on drinks with outstanding pours.  

Guinness, on tap here - pint after pint of merriness.
Vodka drinks were a tall glass FULL of vodka w/ a dash of whatever else you asked for.
Patron shots were given to you in water glasses.... FULL to the rim for minimal cost.  I had to split it into two shots, and even then, it was 2 XL shots.  One nearly knocked me out cold on the spot.  Damn Tequila.

Even cooler is the outdoor patio in the back.  If I recall correctly, it was like an arbor-covered patio w/ flower boxes and just an all around homey feel to it.  There, I kicked my feet up and chilled out as everyone teased me that no matter what I did, they were more wanted here than I was.

As IF I didn't notice.

But the staff @ Pilsner makes it possible for you to not care by filling you up with strong drinks at cheap prices - - and we just hung out until they finally asked everyone to leave.

Seriously - - if you're out for a good time w/ your friends, and want to party it up with good people who know how to have fun, come to Pilsner Inn.  This place rocks.

I still don't quite believe my three friends (one or all three?) are totally straight.  I know what I saw when I entered. But it's okay, because their potential gayness is what brought me to this place.  

Good comes out of everything.

But I will say for the record - - -  I always knew B liked purple entirely too much.
author: Grace K.

description:
All I know is that we ended our '8 bars in 6 hours' marathon here, where we met up with the 'Fabulously Fierce' Darin I for a beer.

We walked straight through the place, right to the back where there was a lovely little covered patio and several benches. Lots of beers on tap. We had Pilsners.. A bit obvious, we know. :)

Darin was kind enough to hold my handbag while we sat and talked.. I'm not sure if it was b/c he was being sweet or maybe he just really liked the damn thing. I mean, it's a hot bag and he's got great taste! 

At any rate, it did the trick. Good, cheap beers and a nice place to drink them. I'd totally hit up the Pilsner again. It's a good place to end your night.
author: Katie A.

description:
Everyone's favorite neighborhood bar... and the bartenders are amazing... and there is a back patio. What is there NOT to like? 

Favorite bartender is Mike, and not just because he is dating my best friend (though that does make for a good story of how they met (not that Im saving it up for talking points in Key West or anything).
author: Jordan Y.

description: I cannot overemphasize the value of a place where you can go on a Friday night and still find enough room to breathe. The bartenders are friendly and attentive, pours are legit, and I didn't get dirty looks for showing up with a bunch of straight people. Pool table, patio, Magic Hat #9 on tap... yes please. Also, prices are completely reasonable -- 3 imported draft beers and a Stoli tonic cost me less than $20.
author: Tracy B.

description:
It's just your average bar really.  I've come here many times to enjoy drinks with friends on several occasions and once while waiting for a table at Chow.

It gets an extra star for the exposed men's restroom that has the trough like urinal...with a large mirror strategically placed along the back wall that shoots out a reflection of your wiener for all the bar to see while you shi shi.  Not the place to go if you get stage fright.
author: Luis M.

description:
I could be at the worst bar in town, but still give an automatic three stars if they have a pinball machine.  Good thing Pilsner Inn is already a cool, breeder-friendly gay bar, with pinball as an added bonus. 

It ended up being a great place to kick my week off with a bang on a Monday night.  Or, rather, a blur - a big, super, happy, drunken blur.  There were some standout moments though, not least of which was getting my beer replaced FOR FREE by the oh-so-patient bartender after getting too excited about pinball and letting my glass of beer tumble and shatter all over the ground.  Somewhere else mixed in the spin art-esque blur of night were some great songs on the jukebox, jokes about high school, blue moon on tap and even more pinball.  I'd definitely check it out again on another visit to the city.

Thumbs Up:
-Blue Moon.
-Pinball!!
-Bartender understanding of my extreme clumsiness.

Thumbs Down:
-Cash only.  What is this?  1995?
author: Hazel Q.

description:
As we were walking down Market towards the Pilsner, my fashion industry friends had some commentary about the people we passed by.  Actually, they mostly addressed the "shims" in their lovely evening wear by singing, "I'm going out" ala Ms. Diana Ross.  So fashion.

The drinks I had were good and it was nice sitting out in their patio area.  

I hadn't been to a bar in the Castro in a while but it was the first time I saw 3 not ugly women practically clear a room.  Eh, we all got to sit down at least.
author: Seong P.

description:
Can I give them six stars?  It's the mellowest gay bar I've ever had the pleasure to be gay at.  

You can find me here most Sunday nights and occasionally during the week.  It is the PERFECT way to end the weekend--with a good friend a few beers.

The only way I'd improve their beer selection would be to add Boont, but they've got Trumer and that's just lovely. 

The back patio is a wonderful hangout--and a great place for conversation or playing cards--no thumping bass here.
author: Eric E.

description:
Yeah! Nothing but 5-stars for the Pilsner. Probably the only bar (apart from Q Bar and perhaps the Lookout) that I enjoy frequenting in the Castro neighborhood.

LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!
And they've got it down pretty good. Market and Church with the Muni lines J, N and F stopping within a block, as does the Fillmore.

Parking? Hell no! You ain't kidding me. You can try the Safeway lot but good luck praying they don't tow you.

They've got two sushi places, Chow's, Crepevine, Muddy Waters and a whole bunch of other restaurants close by. So either you can eat and then get sloshed or get sloshed, totter over and then fill yer face.

Inside the bar, the window seats are good if you want to people watch or want to stake out your target as he / she walks in the front door. In the patio, the benches are good as is the table way at the back

DRINKS... YESHHH! THAS WHAT AH'M... HEY, YOU'RE CUTE!
The beers on tap are pretty darn good and affordable. They do have wine but come on! You don't go into a place like the Pilsner asking for wine!?! Cocktails and the Jagermeisters are pretthy strong so get ready to have your underwear / jock strap / chastity belt / thong / kilt knocked off!

THE CROWD... I'M A CROWD PLEASER!
Crowd is low key, mellow, friendly, so non-pretentious and everyone is just out to have a good time and chat, catch up and yes, cruise too. Met some fun people here, met some drunk people here and met some people people here too. Reminds me of Trax in the Haight.

They got a nice pool table, an ATM (the don't take credit cards, folks so don't wave yo plastic hoping for something fantastic!), an odd telephone booth, game boxes and a pool table (and be polite as you walk to the back patio and not knock someone about to take a shot)

VERDICT
Give me a draft beer and I'm yuurrs! Pilsner saves my day... yet again.
author: Amit S.

description:
OK Bambi has the biggest crush (which by the way I know is mutual) on someone who works  here that has been going on for a good 10 years. (damn am old slut  and I need to get over it or PUT OUT). So I avoid going here since I don't know how I would react to this fine thing who by the way is also a great artist. 

So last Monday after an evening of socializing I ended up getting dragged in here kicking and screaming by a few friends and guess who was at the bar

"Mr hot pants" behind the bar pouring and entertaining. 

Now Pilsner is a great laid back space and there is no need to impress anyone. People go here to just chill at the local bar, play some pool and enjoy the great patio on a sunny afternoon while sipping on a cocktail  with friends and maybe meet someone new.  There is no need to bust out with the designer crap, the attitude or the name dropping cause they don't  and I mean the clientele or the staff don't give a FUCK. 

Oh no not this Bambi... I had the Mr SHOW OFF  I JUST CAME FROM A GREAT PARTY AND CLEARLY I DON'T FIT IN WEARING AN EVENING JACKET look with a designer hat ,fake Gookies that are way better than the real ones and a cell phone in hand all loud and obnoxious while a bit buzzed and blushing (WAY OUT OF LINE) and you  know what Mr Hot Pants was as sweet and gentle and took care of us just like the rest of the crowd that was there enjoying their evening quietly playing pool and sipping on a nice cold one. 

Now that is adorable, kind and deserving of a big smooch. 

The real deal: decent cocktails, pool table, outstanding patio, good service and attractive friendly bartenders.  

Bathroom report: Clean and decent... now the urinal is another story. It is one of those co-ed urinals that is like a tub( I don't know what it is called) there is a huge mirror and if someone is using it while you are get ready for a show. Sometimes it is huge sometimes it is missing if you get my point... OK I will stop before this is flagged.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Pilsner's about as neighborhood bar of a place as you can get in the Castro...simple wood tones, a single central bar, a pool table, and some window boxes coupled with a decently sized patio in the back make for a comfortable place for anyone to relax.  If it weren't for the overwhelming number of men, you'd never think of it as a gay bar, and even then, I still forget that it is sometime.  Definitely just  a place to hang out and have relaxed conversation over a decent variety of beers.

Just be wary of the trough urinal and missing door on the stall.  But other than that, a great place to just hang out.
author: Mark C.

description:
The Eagle has landed - at the Pilsner!   I think it's so cool that the Pilsner has taken up the where the Eagle left off, supporting gay community charities with their Sunday beer busts.  There are so many bars that make a fortune off of gay folks and give absolutely nothing but attitude back.

Besides, the patio is fab - not a grungy back alley for smokers, but a nice place to relax and hang out.   Inside, pinball and pool make it feel like a down home bar.

You don't have to be a "type" to hang out at the Pilsner - just be yourself.  I recommend checking it out on a Sunday afternoon and giving some community charity a boost.
author: Justin S.

description:
Consistantly fun and Shatangi always meets somone new and interesting. Even if you are a non-smoker, check out the patio. Always a livelier crowd (and you can hear yourself think). Great cheap drinks and the sexy-assed bartender with the goatee. I almost forgot, I spent 9/11 there with friends watching the news.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
Wait. Where the hell am I?  Oh that's right.  I am having a "chill evening at home and possibly going out for one drink with friends".  Except that I'm not at home.  I'm on my third drink.  I also keep making friends and it's 1am.  I was under the impression that this would be a gay bar but I just got picked up on by several cuties at the pool tables.  Huge smoking patio and friendly bartenders means I'm doomed and my bed is going to miss me yet again.  
I may as well face it.  This is how I spend my "chill evening at home and possibly going out for one drink with friends" nights.
author: Jill D.

description:
4 stars for -
-Great patio
-Blue Moon on tap. Fuck yeah.
-Reasonable prices
-Hot bartenders. Even if they aren't into pussy, it doesn't mean I can't enjoy the scenery.

No stars for
-Cash only. Have I told you how much this is an inconvenience to ME?

But the Blue Moon on tap is what makes it worth having to go buy a pack of gum at Safeway.
author: Alexis B.

description:
This is what a bar should be. It's spacious on the inside, but not to the point that there are empty corridors that make the bar look unpopular. There are several tv's above the bar and I got to see the end of the Cincinnati/Hawaii game (but honestly, who even cares about the bearcats?). The drinks were tasty and reasonably priced and the pool table is a great space for making out (my hopes, not my reality).

As someone who is extremely pee shy, I didn't appreciate the trough in the bathroom... so I just waited it out until I could use the one toilet. 

Side Note #1: Why do bars feel the need to put mirrors directly above troughs? It's bad enough I don't want people seeing me/me seeing people as they use the loo... this makes it almost unescapeable. 

The HIGHLIGHT of the bar is the patio. It's fun, roomy and there are lots of places to sit and congregate. I was there on a Saturday night around midnight with a group of 6 or 7 people and I never felt crowded or pushed around. 

I'd definitely come back. It's a very chill alternative to the pandemonium surrounding the Pilsner.
author: Jared S.

description:
Loved this bar for several reasons:
1) Beer selection - Awesome! Great beer choices AND they are 
     available to order in my favorite size glass - a pitcher.
2) Seating - The back patio is awesome. Even on a cold, misty day I 
     was glad to sit outside in the city. There is an area that is covered 
     in plexiglass, which helped keep the mist off. It was nice.
3) Crowd - Diverse. Everything from what I call "Hey Girl Gays" - the 
     ones that say "hey girl!" to other gay guys (duh?) to my very sweet, 
     straight, ecclectic friend who indiscreetly changed his pants on the 
     back patio, after giving himself a front-wedgy. And it simply isn't 
     crowded - awesome.
4) Flyers Near the Bathroom - THE BEST FLYERS FOR RANDOM 
     CRAP EVER!! I took 5 and they now decorate my fridge. I learned 
     about an 80's club, Pedro Penis and everything I could ever need to 
     know about AIDS while standing in line for the bathroom. Two 
     thumbs way up!
author: Chia C.

description:
Good bar.  I'm the out of place guy there at 3 pm with a beer and my book =D

Okay selection of beers on tap.  +1 for the big outdoor area with plants.
author: Jason H.

description:
Ok, I may be a bit biased, seeing as how I essentially live at the Pislner (the Pils, as it's been murmured  within my ever inebriated posse), but this is greatest bar in the world ever.

Bartenders: easily the hottest, friendliest men I've ever met.  Even when they're busy taking elaborate orders from the bridge and tunnelers ("What do you mean you don't make mojitos?!") waiting for their tables at Chow, they always take a second to ask how I'm doing, or say "dandy" when I inquire as to their current states.  Coolest.

Drinks:  Some of the barkeeps here will make it their mission in life to get you totally smashed from one jack and coke.  You know the kind: they're pouring the whiskey, and pouring, and pouring, and then the token *squirt* of coke at the end for good measure.  The others settle on forming a nice buzz.  Either way, I've never been disappointed in a drink here.  Also, they have great beer specials nightly.  Don't confuse that with "happy hour" because it lasts all night.  The only night they don't have specials is Friday.

The Patio:  Yes.  Me and the patio are one.  The round table at the end with the plastic chairs that provide superior back support after a long day are best friends.  And the smoking.  Smoking and drinking go together.  And there's a coy pond, and shrubbery.  Need I say more?

(And they got a pool table too!)
author: danielle p.

description: Good beer selection, reasonable prices. Cash only. Fairly loud music in the bar and pool table area, with a quiet back patio.
author: Mara S.

description:
Addams Family Pin Ball
 $18 Bottle of Champagne
 Friends 
+ _______________

=  Fun times on a Monday night.
author: Jay H.

description:
Its like the college bars I hated but everyone here is gay.
Then you think, gay people did THIS? and they keep coming here every week, o no honey.
The outside patio is very nice but cough, cough, its littered with smokers.
I'm told that the smartest gays hang out here, smarter and more successful then the other places.
Hmm, like a phd matters when you bring him home.  
Even a high school dropout gay knows where to find the goods. Pfft.
author: Sean S.

description:
I love this bar and always have. I told my onetime roommate that we were being evicted on their patio. Then I took him here to tell him I was breaking up with my then-girlfriend. And then I took him there to tell him I was gay. And then there was the time that said ex-girlfriend's friend thought it would be funny harass the straight boy by ramming his tongue down my throat (joke's on him!) And then there was the time the bartender tried to pick me up while my date went to the bathroom....So many good memories out there.....

As for the patio - good place to take friends, gay or straight for a mellow night and a good place to find a friend when you're solo. The people are usually friendly (except for the night that this guy I didn't call was there with half of my gym and they all gave me the evil, hairy eyeball all night long). On a warm late summer evening, it's one of my favorites places to grab an unpretentious drink
author: Andy L.

description:
Would have been five stars if the bartender hadn't given my dates attitude.
This place is a gem, the crowd is mellow and lesbian-friendly and the drinks are really cheap for the Castro-Church scene.
I had no idea this was where all the chill lesbians hang out.  No one was trying to "outcool" each other, everyone was just trying to have fun.  There were a lot of groups there, but the place still was comfortably un-crowded.  The patio seemed nice, but it was too cold to enjoy it.
As for the bartender with the ponytail, it was early and the place hadn't even gotten busy yet, and he gave my friends attitude about deciding what they were ordering.  Next time we'll be at the other end of the bar.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Loved it! Went there after work with some coworkers and discovered the awesome back patio area. Lots of greenery, places to sit, and... was that a koi pond? Sweet.

Great low key atmosphere, great people... will definitely be going back.

(update: embarrassingly corrected my spelling of 'koi'... thanks, keane!)
author: Tara B.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 92

I really enjoy coming to the Pils because it's rarely crowded and it's straight friendly with gay appeal. 

The other day, I was struck with a pleasant surprise...

After a 16 hour shift, I head over to the Pils with a co-worker and we went to town on the drinks! And how else do you end a looong day? You gotta have a Bloody Mary.

Now I've had my share of Bloody Mary's. But this by far is the BEST one I've had. Don't get me wrong, I love ZEITGEIST's version of the drink. But I can rarely ever finish them because they're so big and so kick my ass. (I know, if I can't handle the heat, get out of the bar...what?)

But anyway, this drink was well done: perfect portion, all the flavors were melded flawlessly, and it had of course my fave topping of all, lots of BIG OLIVES!

And the location of the Pils (don't you hate that nickname now?) is great. Right on the corner of Church and Market. Great for people watching. But if you want some outdoor/back door action (no pun intended), they have a beautiful back yard set with a pond of koi fish!

Always a great time here.
author: Kristina C.

description:
I love the patio here!  I absolutely love it.  The crowd was random, but had a good mix.  The drinks were pleasurable, and fairly priced.  Gentleman Jack and Coke was only $6.  There is plenty of room here, and the place wasn't too crowded.  

I'm not convinced I adore this place, but it certainly is a change of scene.  I would certainly come here again.  If you want to spice up your bar choices, check out Pilsner.  Just think, right across the street is Sparky's if you have a hunkering for food late at night, too.
author: Brent A.

description: At one point I found this western styled building or bar to be intriguing so I gave it a chance and walked into the saloon styled bar and it felt very "cheers" like , until people started talking and I found most to be very unintelligent and quite rude when I came to interact with them . My last appearance there was two weeks ago on a Wednesday around 4pm. I was treated with total disrespect by the bar tender and his bar friends which most were x drug addicts. I removed myself from the group of x drug addicts after they told me to go back to pacific heights where i belonged and I wasn't wanted at their bar. I went to the front to finish my beer and the bartender was "were you rude" to my friends ? I then explained "no"  I removed myself from their chaos of drama.  He then gave me my money but kept the tip lol but as I walked out we exchanged words as I explained he was rude and I'd never would come back. He then decides to rally his friends at the end of the bar and tells them to say "tell him he looks 50" and being no where near 50 I found it to be so childish . It was like kids bullying the different kid for being himself. The bartender was very unprofessional even if I were the so called victimizer which I was not . If you like trashy x drug addicts and bartenders that ignore their customers by allowing them to smoke weed on the back when a children's school is directly above the bar. Again I do not recommend this bar unless your looking to use the bathroom which is beyond dirty. You Can't pee without privacy or someone looking at your junk at the mirror located directly across from your junk. Oh and let's say one time a girl decided it was okay to lift her dress and piss In the pig feeder your expected to pee into. Again trashy bar and staff!
author: Zeo R.

description:
Went down for last week's DYL night and it's an OK bar. Good selection of beers and spirits, friendly bar staff and it didn't get too crowded, although I left fairly early.

The pool table is there, although I can see playing would get problematic if the bar is more than 50 per cent full. There's also a garden out back for smokers.
author: Iain T.

description:
This is a great bar for before/after dinner on Church Street, or for getting out into the Castro without much of a scene. Rarely have to wait for a drink. Fag hag friendly. They used to have good drink specials but something happened to them.

They could make some improvements to the patio area, but it's a nice alternative to the usual crowded back area.
author: Ian H.

description:
The best gay bar to take straight people to. I Love Chow and Pilsner both, and the fact that they are next door to each other is one of those entropy or synchronicity or whateverity things I love about Frisco.
